00038 /* Idle char */
00039 #define IDLE_CHAR       0xFF
00040 
00042 #define USEDSSPDEV_M            0
00043 
00045 #define USEDSSPDEV_S            1
00046 
00048 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x40
00049 
00050 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == USEDSSPDEV_S)
00051 #error "Master and Slave SSP device are duplicated!"
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 0)
00055 #define SSPDEV_M LPC_SSP0
00056 #elif (USEDSSPDEV_M == 1)
00057 #define SSPDEV_M LPC_SSP1
00058 #elif
00059 #error "Master SSP device not defined!"
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 0)
00063 #define SSPDEV_S LPC_SSP0
00064 #elif (USEDSSPDEV_S == 1)
00065 #define SSPDEV_S LPC_SSP1
00066 #elif
00067 #error "Slave SSP device not defined!"
00068 #endif

00071 uint8_t menu1[] =
00072 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00073 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00074 "SSP demo \n\r"
00075 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00076 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00077 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115.200 kbps \n\r"
00078 " This example uses two SSP peripherals in TI frame format \n\r"
00079 " \t one is set as master mode and the other is set as slave mode. \n\r"
00080 "\t The master and slave transfer a number of data bytes together \n\r"
00081 "\t in interrupt mode \n\r"
00082 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00083 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";

00088 /* These variable below are used in Master SSP interrupt mode -------------------- */
00089 /* Read data pointer */
00090 uint8_t *pRdBuf_M;
00091 /* Write data pointer */
00092 uint8_t *pWrBuf_M;
00093 /* Index of read data mode */
00094 uint32_t RdIdx_M;
00095 /* Index of write data mode */
00096 uint32_t WrIdx_M;
00097 /* Length of data */
00098 uint32_t DatLen_M;
00099 /* Status Flag indicates current SSP transmission complete or not */
00100 __IO Bool complete_M;
00101 /* Master Tx Buffer */
00102 uint8_t Master_Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00103 /* Master Rx Buffer */
00104 uint8_t Master_Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00105 
00106 
00107 /* These variable below are used in Slave SSP interrupt mode -------------------- */
00108 /* Read data pointer */
00109 uint8_t *pRdBuf_S;
00110 /* Write data pointer */
00111 uint8_t *pWrBuf_S;
00112 /* Index of read data mode */
00113 uint32_t RdIdx_S;
00114 /* Index of write data mode */
00115 uint32_t WrIdx_S;
00116 /* Length of data */
00117 uint32_t DatLen_S;
00118 /* Status Flag indicates current SSP transmission complete or not */

00122 /* Slave Rx Buffer */

00145 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00146 /*********************************************************************/
00152 void ssp_Master_IntHandler(void)
00153 {
00154         uint16_t tmp;
00155 
00156         /* Clear all interrupt */
00157         SSP_ClearIntPending(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCLR_ROR);
00158         SSP_ClearIntPending(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCLR_RT);
00159 
00160         /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00161         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_M, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == SET)
00162         {
00163                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_M);
00164                 if ((pRdBuf_M!= NULL) && (RdIdx_M < DatLen_M))
00165                 {
00166                         *(pRdBuf_M + RdIdx_M) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00167                 }
00168                 RdIdx_M++;
00169         }
00170 
00171         /* Check if TX FIFO is not full */
00172         while ((SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_M, SSP_STAT_TXFIFO_NOTFULL) == SET)
00173                         && (WrIdx_M < DatLen_M))
00174         {
00175                 /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00176                 while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_M, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == SET)
00177                 {
00178                         tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_M);
00179                         if ((pRdBuf_M!= NULL) && (RdIdx_M < DatLen_M))
00180                         {
00181                                 *(pRdBuf_M + RdIdx_M) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00182                         }
00183                         RdIdx_M++;
00184                 }
00185 
00186                 if (pWrBuf_M != NULL)
00187                 {
00188                         SSP_SendData(SSPDEV_M, (uint16_t)(*(pWrBuf_M + WrIdx_M)));
00189                 }
00190                 else
00191                 {
00192                         SSP_SendData(SSPDEV_M, IDLE_CHAR);
00193                 }
00194                 WrIdx_M++;
00195         }
00196 
00197         /* There're more data to send */
00198         if (WrIdx_M < DatLen_M)
00199         {
00200                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_TX, ENABLE);
00201         }
00202         /* Otherwise */
00203         else
00204         {
00205                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_TX, DISABLE);
00206         }
00207 
00208         /* There're more data to receive */
00209         if (RdIdx_M < DatLen_M)
00210         {
00211                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_ROR, ENABLE);
00212                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_RT, ENABLE);
00213                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_RX, ENABLE);
00214         }
00215         /* Otherwise */
00216         else
00217         {
00218                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_ROR, DISABLE);
00219                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_RT, DISABLE);
00220                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_M, SSP_INTCFG_RX, DISABLE);
00221         }
00222 
00223         /* Set Flag if both Read and Write completed */
00224         if ((WrIdx_M == DatLen_M) && (RdIdx_M == DatLen_M))
00225         {
00226                 complete_M = TRUE;
00227         }
00228 }
00229

00232 /*********************************************************************/
00238 void ssp_Slave_IntHandler(void)
00239 {
00240         uint16_t tmp;
00241 
00242         /* Clear all interrupt */
00243         SSP_ClearIntPending(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCLR_ROR);
00244         SSP_ClearIntPending(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCLR_RT);
00245 
00246         /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00247         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_S, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == SET)
00248         {
00249                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_S);
00250                 if ((pRdBuf_S!= NULL) && (RdIdx_S < DatLen_S))
00251                 {
00252                         *(pRdBuf_S + RdIdx_S) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00253                 }
00254                 RdIdx_S++;
00255         }
00256 
00257         /* Check if TX FIFO is not full */
00258         while ((SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_S, SSP_STAT_TXFIFO_NOTFULL) == SET)
00259                         && (WrIdx_S < DatLen_S))
00260         {
00261                 /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00262                 while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_S, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == SET)
00263                 {
00264                         tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_S);
00265                         if ((pRdBuf_S!= NULL) && (RdIdx_S < DatLen_S))
00266                         {
00267                                 *(pRdBuf_S + RdIdx_S) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00268                         }
00269                         RdIdx_S++;
00270                 }
00271 
00272                 if (pWrBuf_S != NULL)
00273                 {
00274                         SSP_SendData(SSPDEV_S, (uint16_t)(*(pWrBuf_S + WrIdx_S)));
00275                 }
00276                 else
00277                 {
00278                         SSP_SendData(SSPDEV_S, IDLE_CHAR);
00279                 }
00280                 WrIdx_S++;
00281         }
00282 
00283         /* There're more data to send */
00284         if (WrIdx_S < DatLen_S)
00285         {
00286                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_TX, ENABLE);
00287         }
00288         /* Otherwise */
00289         else
00290         {
00291                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_TX, DISABLE);
00292         }
00293 
00294         /* There're more data to receive */
00295         if (RdIdx_S < DatLen_S)
00296         {
00297                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_ROR, ENABLE);
00298                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_RT, ENABLE);
00299                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_RX, ENABLE);
00300         }
00301         /* Otherwise */
00302         else
00303         {
00304                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_ROR, DISABLE);
00305                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_RT, DISABLE);
00306                 SSP_IntConfig(SSPDEV_S, SSP_INTCFG_RX, DISABLE);
00307         }
00308 
00309         /* Set Flag if both Read and Write completed */
00310         if ((WrIdx_S == DatLen_S) && (RdIdx_S == DatLen_S))
00311         {
00312                 complete_S = TRUE;
00313         }
00314 }

00322 void SSP0_IRQHandler(void)
00323 {
00324 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 0)
00325         ssp_Master_IntHandler();
00326 #endif
00327 
00328 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 0)
00329         ssp_Slave_IntHandler();
00330 #endif
00331 }

00333 /*********************************************************************/
00338 void SSP1_IRQHandler(void)
00339 {
00340 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 1)
00341         ssp_Master_IntHandler();
00342 #endif
00343 
00344 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 1)

00350 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00351 /*********************************************************************/
00359 int32_t ssp_MasterReadWrite (LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx,
00360                          void *rbuffer,
00361                          void *wbuffer,
00362                          uint32_t length)
00363 {
00364         uint16_t tmp;
00365         pRdBuf_M = (uint8_t *) rbuffer;
00366     pWrBuf_M = (uint8_t *) wbuffer;
00367     DatLen_M = length;
00368     RdIdx_M = 0;
00369     WrIdx_M = 0;
00370 
00371     // wait for current SSP activity complete
00372     while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_BUSY));
00373 
00374         /* Clear all remaining data in RX FIFO */
00375         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY))
00376         {
00377                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPx);
00378         }
00379 
00380 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 0)
00381         if (length != 0)
00382         {
00383                 SSP0_IRQHandler();
00384         }
00385 #endif
00386 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 1)
00387         if (length != 0)
00388         {
00389                 SSP1_IRQHandler();
00390         }
00391 #endif
00392 
00393         // Return 0
00394         return 0;
00395 }
00396 
00397 /*********************************************************************/
00405 int32_t ssp_SlaveReadWrite (LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx,
00406                          void *rbuffer,
00407                          void *wbuffer,
00408                          uint32_t length)
00409 {
00410         uint16_t tmp;
00411         pRdBuf_S = (uint8_t *) rbuffer;
00412     pWrBuf_S = (uint8_t *) wbuffer;
00413     DatLen_S = length;
00414     RdIdx_S = 0;
00415     WrIdx_S = 0;
00416 
00417     // wait for current SSP activity complete
00418     while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_BUSY))
00419     {
00420         tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPx);
00421     }
00422 
00423         /* Clear all remaining data in RX FIFO */
00424         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY))
00425         {
00426                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(SSPx);
00427         }
00428 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 0)
00429         if (length != 0)
00430         {
00431                 SSP0_IRQHandler();
00432         }
00433 #endif
00434 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 1)
00435         if (length != 0)
00436         {
00437                 SSP1_IRQHandler();
00438         }
00439 #endif
00440 
00441         // Return 0
00442         return 0;
00443 }

00446 /*********************************************************************/
00451 void Buffer_Init(void)
00452 {
00453         uint8_t i;
00454 
00455         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00456                 Master_Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00457                 Slave_Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00458                 Master_Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00459                 Slave_Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00460         }
00461 
00462 }
00463 
00464 /*********************************************************************/
00469 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00470 {
00471         uint8_t i;
00472         uint8_t *pMTx = (uint8_t *) &Master_Tx_Buf[0];
00473         uint8_t *pSTx = (uint8_t *) &Slave_Tx_Buf[0];
00474         uint8_t *pMRx = (uint8_t *) &Master_Rx_Buf[0];
00475         uint8_t *pSRx = (uint8_t *) &Slave_Rx_Buf[0];
00476 
00477         for ( i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++ )
00478         {
00479                 if ((*pSRx++ != *pMTx++) || (*pMRx++ != *pSTx++))
00480                 {
00481                         /* Call Error Loop */
00482                         Error_Loop();
00483                 }
00484         }
00485 }
00486 
00487 /*********************************************************************/
00492 void Error_Loop(void)
00493 {
00494         /* Loop forever */
00495         _DBG_("Verify fail!\n\r");
00496         while (1);
00497 }

00507         _DBG(menu1);

00511 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00512 /*********************************************************************/
00517 int c_entry(void)
00518 {
00519         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00520 
00521         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00522          *  115200bps
00523          *  8 data bit
00524          *  No parity
00525          *  1 stop bit
00526          *  No flow control
00527          */
00528         debug_frmwrk_init();
00529 
00530         // print welcome screen
00531         print_menu();
00532 
00533         /*
00534          * Initialize SSP pin connect
00535          * P0.6 - SSEL1
00536          * P0.7 - SCK1
00537          * P0.8 - MISO1
00538          * P0.9 - MOSI1
00539          */
00540         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00541         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00542         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00543         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00544         PinCfg.Pinnum = 6;
00545         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00546         PinCfg.Pinnum = 7;
00547         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00548         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00549         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00550         PinCfg.Pinnum = 9;
00551         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00552 
00553 
00554         /*
00555          * Initialize SSP pin connect
00556          * P0.15 - SCK
00557          * P0.16 - SSEL
00558          * P0.17 - MISO
00559          * P0.18 - MOSI
00560          */
00561         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00562         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00563         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00564         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00565         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00566         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00567         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00568         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00569         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00570         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00571         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00572         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00573 
00574         /* Initializing Master SSP device section ------------------------------------------- */
00575         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00576         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00577         // Re-configure SSP to TI frame format
00578         SSP_ConfigStruct.FrameFormat = SSP_FRAME_TI;
00579         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00580         SSP_Init(SSPDEV_M, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00581 
00582         // Enable SSP peripheral
00583         SSP_Cmd(SSPDEV_M, ENABLE);
00584 
00585 
00586     /* Initializing Slave SSP device section ------------------------------------------- */
00587         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00588         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00589         /* Re-configure mode for SSP device */
00590         SSP_ConfigStruct.Mode = SSP_SLAVE_MODE;
00591         // Re-configure SSP to TI frame format
00592         SSP_ConfigStruct.FrameFormat = SSP_FRAME_TI;
00593         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00594         SSP_Init(SSPDEV_S, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00595 
00596         // Enable SSP peripheral
00597         SSP_Cmd(SSPDEV_S, ENABLE);
00598 
00599         /* Interrupt configuration section ------------------------------------------------- */
00600 #if ((USEDSSPDEV_S == 0) || (USEDSSPDEV_M == 0))
00601         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00602         NVIC_SetPriority(SSP0_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00603         /* Enable SSP0 interrupt */
00604         NVIC_EnableIRQ(SSP0_IRQn);
00605 #endif
00606 #if ((USEDSSPDEV_S == 1) || (USEDSSPDEV_M == 1))
00607         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00608         NVIC_SetPriority(SSP1_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00609         /* Enable SSP0 interrupt */
00610         NVIC_EnableIRQ(SSP1_IRQn);
00611 #endif
00612 
00613         /* Initializing Buffer section ------------------------------------------------- */
00614         Buffer_Init();
00615 
00616         /* Start Transmit/Receive between Master and Slave ----------------------------- */
00617         complete_S = FALSE;
00618         complete_M = FALSE;
00619 
00620         /* Slave must be ready first */
00621         ssp_SlaveReadWrite(SSPDEV_S, Slave_Rx_Buf, Slave_Tx_Buf, BUFFER_SIZE);
00622         /* Then Master can start its transferring */
00623         ssp_MasterReadWrite(SSPDEV_M, Master_Rx_Buf, Master_Tx_Buf, BUFFER_SIZE);
00624 
00625         /* Wait for complete */
00626         while ((complete_S == FALSE) || (complete_M == FALSE));
00627 
00628         /* Verify buffer */
00629         Buffer_Verify();
00630 
00631         _DBG_("Verify success!\n\r");
00632     /* Loop forever */
00633     while(1);
00634     return 1;
00635 }
00636 
00637 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00638    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00639    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00640    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00641    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00642 int main(void)
00643 {
00644     return c_entry();
00645 }

00648 #ifdef  DEBUG
00649 /*******************************************************************************
00650 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00651 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00652 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00653 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00654 * @return               None
00655 *******************************************************************************/
00656 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00657 {
00658         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00659          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00660 
00661         /* Infinite loop */
00662         while(1);
00663 }
00664 #endif
